message:

title: 178 people rescued amid Texas flood watch :  Were not out of the woods yet
message:
178 people rescued amid Texas flood watch: 'We're not out of the woods yet'A flood watch remains in effect for more than 11 million people in Texas and Oklahoma on Saturday as a number of flood warnings were issued as residents are urged not to drive on flooded roads.
During a press conference on Saturday afternoon, Harris County, Texas, Judge Lina Hidalgo said 178 people and 122 pets have been rescued amid the flooding, and no deaths or injuries have been reported.
"We're not out of the woods yet and a level of uncertainty remains," Hidalgo said.
The heaviest rain has eased up in southeast Texas on Saturday morning, with the region set to experience a reprieve for the day.
Meanwhile, powerful thunderstorms have popped up seemingly every day this week across parts of Texas, and that will be the case again on Saturday.

title: Jefferson Parish leaders urge preparation for hurricane season ; permits required for roof work
message:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - Jefferson Parish leaders urge everyone to take the approaching hurricane season seriously and begin making plans now.
And people getting new roofs in Jefferson need to follow new rules.
Parish President Cynthia Lee Sheng says hurricanes over the past several years have intensified quickly.
Unlike when Hurricane Ida hit Jefferson Parish in 2021, the parish now has permit requirements for property owners who need a new roof any time of the year.
Dan Mills, CEO of the Homebuilders Association of Greater New Orleans joined Lee Sheng and others at the press conference.
